climbs.name: Sunday Afternoon
climbs.fa: Dave Haber, Sheryl Haber, and Steve Parker, April 1991

content.description: A rather grainy fist crack. This climb is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.

climbs.name: Route Canal
climbs.fa: Steve Parker, Sheryl Haber, and Dave Haber, April 1991

content.description: Hand jamming up along a slanting flake. This climb is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.

This is the left of two bolted routes and located a short distance left of

Cadillac Desert

. South-facing and sunny most of the day, this can be a good choice for those chilly winter days.

A bouldery and somewhat awkward start over a bulge gets one onto a steep tan-colored slab where the crux will be found. Gear belay and an easy scramble off the back.
content.protection: 5 bolts (all 3/8"), medium cams for the anchor

content.description:
Incut patina edges lead up to the crux, which comes at mid-height where the rock turns tan in color and the holds get less positive. Here you'll be forced to utilize tips friction while you get your feet over a bulge. The climb eases after the crux and is your standard Josh steep slab to the top.

Also the name of an eye-opening book by Marc Reisner about water and the development of the desert southwest.
content.location:
This is the bolted line between

Irie Heights

and

Sunday Afternoon

which starts inside a wide chimney and climbs an attractive, brown patina face.
